message: I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! I think it's a great opportunity for you to acquire a valuable asset. I'm willing to sell it to you for $18,000. What do you think?
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $12,000. I'm willing to pay that price, but I'm not sure if it's the best deal for me.

I understand that $12,000 is a bit low for me, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can offer it to you for $16,000. It's a great deal for you, considering the product's value to you is only $8,000. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I was thinking more along the lines of $14,000. I'm willing to pay that price, but I'm not sure if it's the best deal for me.

I can see you're serious about getting a good deal, but I'm not willing to go any lower than $17,000. It's a fair price considering the product's value to me is much higher than $14,000. What do you think?

I understand that you're trying to get a good price, but I'm still not convinced that $17,000 is a fair price for me. I'm willing to pay $15,500 for the product, and I think that's a reasonable compromise.
I appreciate your persistence, but I'm not willing to go any lower than $18,500. I'm willing to meet you at $16,000, but I think $18,500 is the minimum I'm willing to accept. What do you think?

I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still not willing to go above $16,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I think $16,000 is the maximum I'm willing to pay. I'm hoping we can finalize the deal at this price.

I'm not willing to sell the product to you for $16,000, but I'm willing to make one last concession. I can offer it to you for $17,000. If you're still not interested, I'll have to consider other options.

I appreciate your last offer, but I'm still not willing to pay $17,000. I've made it clear that I'm willing to pay up to $16,000, and I'm not budging from that price. If you're not willing to meet me at that price, I'll have to consider other options.
